articles.description:
Capcom's series about big beasts and the clothes you can skin/steal from them continues in Monster Hunter Wilds, which looked as great as ever in its newest trailer from tonight's Summer Game Fest show. We get new peeks at some lovely dunes, reptile-chicken mounts and bulky weapons. Oh, and some monsters ripe for huntin', presumably.

 
Read more
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds' new trailer shows sick cutscenes and lizard-worms that are gonna make even sicker pants

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
This year’s Day Of The Devs boasted an entire seven exclusives, plus a load of other nifty features and previews for exciting indies we already knew about, but are no less excited to be reminded of. It’s been over ten years now since Tim Schafer and the folks at Double Fine kicked off the non-profit initiative to help shine a spotlight on games what they thought were nice. No way! I love games what I think are nice! Here’s everything from Day Of The Devs 2024, dutifully arranged for your clicking pleasure.
Read more
articles.title: Everything announced and featured at Day Of The Devs 2024 in one place

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Enough moons ago to qualify as quite a lot of moons but not so much for me to categorise them as ‘many’, Alice Bee wrote about an Itch game called Kevin Costner’s Waterworld - a fully playable extrapolation of a Simpsons’ joke from three decades ago. Simpsons jokes from three decades making up most of my sense of humour, I of course thought it was brilliant. And yet, I couldn’t shake a singular, burning question: What if this, but not joke? Enter Tides Of Tomorrow. Ok, so I actually don't know if it has anything in common with Waterworld aside from having lots of water everywhere. Still, I'll never pass up an opportunity for a crispy Simpsons reference.
 
Read more
articles.title: We’re finally getting our big budget Kevin Costner’s Waterworld game in Tides Of Tomorrow

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
UFO 50 is a collection of fictional retro games designed as if they were made for a non-existent games console 40 years ago, but in reality have been developed as brand new titles for an upcoming collection from indie devs including Spelunky creator Derek Yu. With the ambitious project nearing a decade in its own development, though, those games have now taken on their own real history in addition to their made-up one. Those histories will meet this September, when UFO 50 finally sees the light of day.
Read more
articles.title: Spelunky creator’s mega-collection of fictional retro games UFO 50 will finally be out this September

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Before we get to the latest trailer for S-Game's soulslike Phantom Blade Zero I have a couple of complaints to lodge about the title. Firstly, this game clearly contains a non-zero quantity of blades, from whacking great axes to katanas. Secondly, I do not accept the premise that these are phantom blades. They are very obviously non-spectral, going by the amount of stabbing and clanging on show in the video. With these potentially ruinous caveats out of the way, I am now free to tell you more about a game that looks like it's out to eat Sekiro's lunch.
 
Read more
articles.title: Latest Phantom Blade Zero trailer sure makes it look like an over-powered Sekiro

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Are Tamagotchis a thing now again? I’m getting a sense they might be, but I’ll always associate them with the nineties. Ah, to return to a simpler time, where kids tripped each other up in the school hallways to steal toys , before Pokémon cards came along and everyone leveled up to stabbings. Sorry, Petal Runner devs, for opening a news article about your lovely wholesome game talking about stabbings. This gorgeous, fuschia-splashed, slice-of-life RPG is, if anything, the antidote to stabbings. In terms of game fatigue, anyway. It won’t cure tetanus, at least I don’t think so.
 
Read more
articles.title: Petal Runner is a slice-of-life Gameboy Advance style RPG about being a digital pet courier

articles.author: Kaan Serin
articles.description:
When the Summer Game Fest trailer for "narrative-centric cosy game" Wanderstop said it was from the creator behind The Stanley Parable, I thought I had surely entered a different dimension where The Stanley Parable was actually a wholesome shop-keeping sim rather than a zig-zagging office-based nightmare. Then Wanderstop started to get rather bleak, and I finally stopped pinching myself. See for yourself.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Stanley Parable co-creator announces a tea-brewing sim that's secretly not-so-cosy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové Human Interface Guidelines pro KDE, Wine 9.11 opravuje 27 chyb, Intel Vulkan se spustí téměř dvakrát rychleji, oprava pro AMD Ryzeny: už se probudí ze spánku i s NVMe SSD.
articles.title: Správně se budící Ryzeny s NVMe, Plasma 6.1 už za několik hodin

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Z průzkumu, který projekt FreeBSD provedl v poslední době mezi svými uživateli, vyplývá řada zajímavostí. Podívejme se blíže, jak se dnes typicky FreeBSD používá i jaký je jeho uživatel.
articles.title: Uživatelé hodnotí FreeBSD v roce 2024: přidat na komunitě, díky za ZFS a stabilitu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Tauchman)
articles.description: Disketovka k osmibitu byl dříve nedostižný sen, tak jsem si jednu koupil. V poslední části se budeme věnovat postupu, jak vytvořit vlastní disketu a také, jak se projeví použití cartridge Fast Load.
articles.title: Commodore 1541-II: vytváření vlastních disket a použití cartridge Fast Load

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Pipeline je v současném IT jedno z nejzneužívanějších slov. V jazyku Coconut lze pipeline používat ve smyslu kolon, tedy pro zajištění předávání návratových hodnot funkcí do jiných funkcí, což je základ tacit programmingu.
articles.title: Konstrukce kolon a kompozice funkcí v jazyku Coconut

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: The Mirror, alternativa ke hře Roblox, uvolnil svůj zdrojový kód. Neoficiální port hry Zelda se jmenuje 2 Ship 2 Harkinian. Klasika Descent 3 od Outrage Entertainment je nyní k dispozici pod svobodnou licencí.
articles.title: Hra The Mirror je open-source, klon Zeldy se jmenuje 2 Ship 2 Harkinian

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: V dnešní sklizni se ponoříme do světa komunikace, bezpečnosti a prezentací. Představíme si nástroje, které vám umožní udržet kontakt s vaším sociálním okruhem, ochránit vaše digitální data a prezentovat vaše myšlenky v terminálu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (12. 6. 2024): jedna aplikace na všechny komunikační sítě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 6. června proběhlo tradiční setkání k příležitosti Dne IPv6. Přechod na internetový protokol nové generace nepřináší jenom technické výzvy (o kterých se také mluvilo), ale i řadu organizačních překážek.
articles.title: Česko samo přechod na IPv6 nezvládne, trh to nevyřeší, říká Ondřej Filip

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: V dnešním vydání postřehů se podíváme na masivní únik dat Ticketmasteru, několikastupňový útok na Ukrajinu, spolupráci čínských skupin na kyberšpionážní kampani nebo malware Decoy Dog útočící na Rusko.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: spolupráce čínských skupin a zero-day v TikToku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Edice openSUSE Aeon Desktop RC2 získává nové funkce. Opera ve spolupráci se společností Google představila novou funkci, která uživatelům umožňuje generovat obrázky pomocí umělé inteligence. Ubuntu 23.10 končí podpora.
articles.title: Aeon Desktop se formuje, Opera bude umět generovat obrázky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Google posílá do projektu Mesa podporu Fuchsia OS, 40 let od uvedení původního Tetrisu, OBS Studio 30.2 Beta přináší nativní podporu NVENC, 70 let od úmrtí Alana Turinga.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1 blíže, OBS Studio s podporou NVENC na Linuxu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Tým pro dlouhodobou podporu Debianu (LTS) oznámil, že pětiletá prodloužená podpora Debianu 10 Buster skončí 30. června 2024, tedy téměř pět let po jeho prvním vydání 6. července 2019. Od července tedy už nebude Debian 10 dostávat další bezpečnostní aktualizace. Další bezpečnostní záplaty je možné získat pomocí komerčních nabídek třetí strany (ELTS).
articles.title: Konec pětileté prodloužené podpory pro Debian 10 Buster

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Mozilla dostala od Roskomnadzoru požadavek, aby ve svém obchodu permanentně zablokovala pět doplňků, které jsou „zneužívány k obcházení cenzury“ v Rusku. Šlo o Censor Tracker, Runet Censorship Bypas, dvě VPN služby Planet VPN a FastProxy. Vlastní VPN od Mozilly je dostupné jen ve 33 státech a Rusko mezi nimi není (u nás ano).
articles.title: Mozilla blokovala v Rusku doplňky, které obchází cenzuru. Nyní už vše funguje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V sobotu policie zatkla tureckého studenta, který podváděl u standardní zkoušky TYT na univerzitě v jihozápadní provincii Isparta. Podvod byl sofistikovaný. V botě měl ukrytý router s přístupem na internet. Otázky snímal kamerou zamaskovanou jako knoflík a odpovědi mu umělá inteligence četla přímo do sluchátka v uchu.
articles.title: Turecký student podváděl u zkoušky na univerzitě pomocí AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Evropské centrum pro digitální práva noyb podává stížnost na Privacy Sandbox v Chrome. Ten si uživatelé mohou zapnout od loňského roku (opt-in), což by mělo funkčně nahradit sledovací cookies třetích stran. Ty snad budou již příští rok vypnuté?
articles.title: noyb podává stížnost na Privacy Sandbox v Chrome

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: AMD Fast CPPC (Collaborative Processor Performance Control) je vlastnost procesorů Zen4 a novějších, která umožňuje rychlejší přepínání frekvencí procesoru. To jednak zvyšuje výkon a také snižuje spotřebu.
articles.title: AMD Fast CPPC bude v jádře 6.11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Poptávka po IT odbornících v oblasti kvality a testování softwaru roste. Vývojáři se snaží psát kód tak, aby fungoval správně, ale mohou přehlédnout některé chyby. Taková chyba ale může způsobit velké problémy. Tester je proto nepostradatelnou součástí vývojového procesu a je zásadním prvkem vývoje softwaru. Dívá se na software z pohledu uživatele a pomáhá vše ladit k dokonalosti.
articles.title: Testing Akademie: naučte se testovat kvalitu softwaru v online kurzu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nový AI pomocník do Windows 11 Recall měl vyjít již příští týden 18. června. Recall ukládá snímky obrazovky, aby si uživatel mohl později najít, co na počítači dělal. Uživatelé však novou funkci nepřijali s nadšením, mají obavy o své soukromí.
articles.title: Kontroverzní Recall ve Windows 11 měl vyjít již příští týden, ale bude odložen na neurčito

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Google oznámil přechod ChromeOS ze standardního linuxového jádra na jádro ze systému Android. Důvodem je integrace frameworků z Androidu s cílem jednoduše používat aplikace z Androidu v ChromeOS bez mezivrstev.
articles.title: ChromeOS opouští čisté linuxové jádro

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Canonical dnes zveřejnil informace o počítači DC-ROMA RISC-V II od společnosti DeepComputing. Půjde o osmijádrový notebook s procesorem využívajícím architekturu RISC-V, na kterém bude předinstalovaná linuxová distribuce Ubuntu.
articles.title: DC-ROMA II bude osmijádrový notebook s RISC-V a Ubuntu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Nadace FreeBSD Foundation zveřejnila výsledky průzkumu v komunitě FreeBSD, ve kterém se snažila zjistit zajímavé informace o uživatelích FreeBSD a jejich způsobu používání tohoto operačního systému. Průzkum obsahoval 50 otázek a zúčastnilo se ho 1446 uživatelů.
articles.title: Komunita okolo FreeBSD vidí ZFS jako nejcennější serverovou funkci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Rok po vydání openSUSE Leap 15.5 byla dle očekávání vydána nová verze 15.6, která představuje dílčí aktualizaci s plánovanou podporou do konce roku 2025, což by mělo dát uživatelům dostatek prostoru pro přechod na tak trochu revoluční verzi 16.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap 15.6 vylepšuje podporu kontejnerů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: anonymní)
articles.description: Společnost Vodafone krátce po blokaci domén datoid.cz a datoid.sk začala blokovat domény edisk.cz a sledujteto.cz. Uživatelům se stejně jako v předchozím případě zobrazuje informace, že je web blokován na základě zákona o hazardu.
articles.title: Vodafone blokuje domény edisk.cz a sledujteto.cz na základě předběžného opatření

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nové vydání balíku systemd je na světě a s ním již dříve avizovaná implementace náhrady za sudo, tedy nástroj run0.
articles.title: Nová verze systemd 256 s run0, systemd-vpick či importctl

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Vedení organizace ICANN dnes v rwandském Kigali oznámilo, že následující ICANN Policy Forum proběhne příští červen v Praze. Jedna z vrcholných akcí organizace ICANN se do Česka vrátí po třinácti letech a sdružení CZ.NIC bude opět jejím hostitelem.
articles.title: Praha opět přivítá jednu z tradičních konferencí organizace ICANN

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: HTTPS se stává běžným, většina webů už ho nasadila. Jak to ale udělat správně, opravdu bezpečně a hlavně bezbolestně? Na školení HTTPS pro správce serverů si ukážeme si nejnovější trendy, prakticky si vyzkoušíme vygenerování certifikátu a nasazení na web server.
articles.title: HTTPS pro správce serverů (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jsme na cestě, hlásí Koichiro Iwao o AlmaLinuxu a Raspberry Pi 5. Práce na podpoře poslední generace malinového stroječku založili vývojáři na obrazech pro předchozí verzi. Koichiro konstatuje, že jádro systému použité v buildech AlmaLinuxu pro Raspberry Pi typicky zakládá na jádru, které v rámci CentOS připravuje Pablo Greco. Pak už „jen“ stačilo naučit se bootovací proces a rozdíly mezi čtyřkou a pětkou.
articles.title: AlmaLinux s podporou Raspberry Pi 5

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Kolem Intel oneAPI loni na podzim vystavěná nadace UXL (Unified Acceleration Foundation) ve spolupráci s Khronos Group oznamují další logický krok: oficiálně běžící spolupráci The Khronos Group, stojící mimo jiné za standardy OpenGL A Vulkan, a samotné UXL Foundation.
articles.title: Nadace UXL (oneAPI) navazuje spolupráci s Khronos Group

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Společnost Tuxedo hodlá v budoucnu nabídnout i notebook postavený na ARM SoC Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite. Prototyp ukázala na letošním Computexu, šlo o 14palcový stroj s displejem o rozlišení 2560×1600 s 32GB LPDDR5X pamětí a PCIe 4.0 NVMe SSD.
articles.title: Tuxedo připravuje linuxový notebook se Snapdragonem X Elite

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Počínaje Firefoxem 127, jenž již leží hotový na FTP serverech Mozilly (novinky budou časem shrnuty v obvyklém přehledu, prozatím vezměme zavděk beta verzí), se bude 32bitová verze pro Linux tvářit navenek jako „x86_64“, a to ryze kvůli skutečnosti, že 32bitových instalací už je tak malé množství, že by sama tato informace mohla přispívat k fingerprintingu daného uživatele.
articles.title: Firefox 127 předstírá u 32bitové verze, že je 64bitový

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Dorka Volavkova)
articles.description: V čtvrtek 13. června začíná v Brně na FIT VUT třídenní konference DevConf.CZ. Vstup na konferenci je zdarma, ale je nutné se registrovat. Zbývá už jen pár míst, proto doporučujeme se registrovat co nejdříve. Pokud se nemůžete zúčastnit osobně, konferenci můžete sledovat také živě prostřednictvím youtubového kanálu.
articles.title: Konference DevConf.CZ 2024 začíná tento týden

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V PHP od verze 5.x byla před měsícem ve Windows objevena kritická zranitelnost CVE-2024–4577. Chyba může způsobit vzdálené spuštění kódu. Nuka-Cola is as much a part of the world of Fallout as radiation is. After taking over the beverage industry in the lead up to the war, caps from the drinks formed the currency used throughout each game, but there are still some fresh Nuka-Cola bottles out there, like Nuka-Cola Orange, you can enjoy. 


Nuka-Cola Orange is one of the rarest Nuka-Cola drinks in Fallout 76. It's incredibly hard to come across outside of a vendor, and even when you do find it out in the world, there's a good chance another Vault Dweller is looking for that very same bottle, so you'd better pick it up and run. Luckily, there are a few guaranteed locations where you can find this refreshing citrus variation of the Nuka-Cola recipe.


Where to find Nuka-Cola Orange in Fallout 76


The only way to get Nuka-Cola O…
articles.title: How to get Nuka-Cola Orange in Fallout 76

The Life is Strange series is hailed for its impressive storytelling, iconic characters, and emotional impact. From the lighthouse in Arcadia Bay to the record store in Haven Springs, the spaces created for the games are filled to the brim with nostalgic feelings. As the series has grown, so too has the complexity of its timeline. 


Not counting Life is Strange: Double Exposure, which is due to come out later this year, the Life is Strange series currently spans about 12 years. However, the choices you make, particularly at the end of the original game, can send this timeline into a spin. Here’s a more organized look at all the Life is Strange games in chronological order.   


Farewell Episode DLC (Life is Strange: Before the Storm)


Year it takes place: 2008


The Life is Strange timel…
articles.title: All Life is Strange Games in Order: The Complete Series Timeline

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
From speedrunning to interesting mods to porting the games in unusual ways, Doom persists because it transcends the pixelated world built by its original developers. Now that The Dark Ages has been announced, id Software's iconic series is once again in the public eye.


Although, it never really stopped being part of the wider gaming conversation. As a series, Doom has not only survived against an ever-changing industry, but has stayed relevant and continues to be successful. Sure, there was a period where it felt like it may not ever make a glorious comeback, but it's stuck around because somebody needs to keep the demons of hell at bay.


With the new game on the horizon, I thought it was time to remind ourselves just where it all began. This brief history of Doom aims to reflect on the…
articles.title: Doom: a brief history of gaming’s greatest FPS

articles.author: Shane Weaver
articles.description:
Final Fantasy XVI ended up being one of my favorite games from last year. Clive’s journey to liberate the oppressed magic-weiding Bearers of Valisthea and cleanse the world of the spreading Blight won me over with its earnest and lovable characters, flashy and frenetic fights, serene and grandiose soundscapes, and the titanic, cinematic boss battles that are simply unforgettable.


But for all of its many achievements, Final Fantasy XVI felt a bit simple and underdeveloped at times. A number of design choices seem derived from the developer’s previous experience with Final Fantasy XIV, while other elements fail to meet the same complexity and variety as its MMO counterpart.


If the recently rebranded Creative Studio III gets an opportunity to follow up on this style of Final Fantasy game,…
articles.title: Five improvements we’d like to see in a Final Fantasy XVI successor

Although you don't need a specific job pack or expansion to complete this challenge, it helps to have God Mode to start with 100 perce…

articles.author: Colin Fritz
articles.description:
Resident Evil developer Capcom recently announced that it will bring the seventh entry in its iconic series, Resident Evil Biohazard, to all Apple devices with an M1 chip or better. For Mac laptops, that means any Mac Book Air or Mac Book Pro from late 2020 onwards will be able to run the game.


However, this isn’t the first time Capcom has released a Mac and iOS port for the Resident Evil series. The current Mac Resident Evil games are essentially a dedicated showcase of just how powerful the M-series chips and integrated graphics cards can be, especially on devices such as the Mac Book Air, which don’t have a fan. 


Resident Evil Games for Mac Available Now


Mac and iPhone users can currently purchase both Resident Evil Village and the Resident Evil 4 remake via their device’s App Store. Resident Evil Village on Mac in particular is a spectacle to behold; I can personally vouch for its impressive performance on the M1 Mac Book Air. While there have been a few audio glitches here and there, the port is exceptionally well optimized. 


Image via Capcom


The Resident Evil 4 remake on M1 devices also has generally positive reviews on the Mac App Store, though users should note that you’ll need approximately 125 GB of free space on your drive to install the game, which is nearly double the listed size requirement in the store. 


Upcoming Resident Evil Games for Mac


The Resident Evil Biohazard Mac and iOS port is currently slated for July 2nd, 2024. However, Capcom has also announced on its Apple games page that it will be bringing the Resident Evil 2 remake to all M-series Apple devices as well. We don’t have a release date for this one yet, but if the previous Mac Resident Evil ports are anything to go by, it’s sure to be an exceptional experience.

The post Resident Evil on Mac: Which Games are on Apple Devices? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Resident Evil on Mac: Which Games are on Apple Devices?

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
After choosing to save the children in a recent Major Order, Helldivers 2 players have been showing a softer side of themselves. Through fan art that usually shows memes or epic landscapes, players are instead highlighting those they fight for in the Helldivers universe. 


Usually, Major Orders are little more than flavor text that justifies playing more Helldivers 2. Yes, they add to the story, but the gameplay is what we're all here for, and if we can make it into just one more mission by shouting, "Won't someone please think of the children?!" then we're absolutely going to do it. Right now, though, Helldivers 2 players are experiencing a more somber mood, sharing artwork that commemorates the children and civilians they save on a daily basis, not just in the recent Major Order.


Hell…
articles.title: Helldivers 2’s recent Major Order has players questioning why they really fight

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
We’ve become very accustomed to seeing new Paldeck videos released by Palworld every weekend, but the one released on June 15 is slightly different. Rather than showcasing a Pal we’ve come to know, they showed off a Pal that we’ve yet to meet — Chillet Ignis. 




Chillet has become a huge fan favorite among players. The original Ice type Pal is a fluffy looking Dragon capable of inflicting huge damage, all while looking cute, and the Ignis variant is no different. 


Chillet Ignis looks like someone took the original Chillet and turned up the color temperature, which is apt, because as a Fire type this Pal is likely to bring the heat. Apparently, Chillet Ignis is capable of spinning so fast it will emit sparks, so it might be best to give this one a wide berth until it warms up to you. Pun intended. 


The Alpha Chillet Ignis shown in the Paldeck video is a level 52, which is an exciting reminder that more levels are coming when the Sakurajima update arrives on June 27. This is excellent news to anyone like myself, who has taken a break through a lack of levels to climb or new content to experience. 


We’re usually given two Paldeck videos each weekend, so the next should release tomorrow. The sneak peak at the end of the Chillet Ignis video shows another much loved Pal, despite the fact that it’s not even in the game yet — Croajiro, the small frog armed with a stick. 


Image via Pocketpair

The post Palworld showcases a new Pal in latest Paldeck video ahead of Sakurajima update appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Palworld showcases a new Pal in latest Paldeck video ahead of Sakurajima update

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
As any fan of Palworld will tell you, the game is ripe with possibilities for merch and goodies to decorate our homes. From plushes to figurines, clothing and even terrifying nightmare fuel, if you look hard enough you’ll be able to find everything Palworld related, but none of it is official merch. 


Posting on Twitter this morning, Pocketpair has assured that there is indeed some official merchandise on the way, if fans can wait a just little longer to get their hands on it. 




Accompanying this plea was a purposefully faded image of a Cattiva plush, giving fans something to get excited about. However, the comments were mostly focused on fans asking for their favorite Pal in plush form - although a staggering lack of those are after a Depresso plush, I must say. 


Unofficial Palworld…
articles.title: Pocketpair assures fans official Palworld merch is coming if they can wait a little longer

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
Horror requires a certain degree of unpredictability to really succeed. That can be difficult when you’re trying to keep things believable, so why not throw believability in the trash can? 


Anthology for the Killer is a compilation of nine previously available, completely absurd, short-form horror titles that have decided, as many of us have, that reality really sucks. But while there’s a heaping dose of comedy mixed inseparably with the rest of the horror stew, the pure discomfort of not finding a reliable grip is enough to make you sweat. Or whatever people do when they’re afraid.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Anthology of the Killer (PC)
Developer: thecatamites
Publisher: thecatamites
Released: May 29, 2024
MSRP: $6.00


The Anthology of the Killer staples together nine related short …
articles.title: Review: Anthology of the Killer

articles.author: Leo Gillick
articles.description:
The joy found in science fiction novels is, of course, entirely subjective. Some love a series that keeps things only galaxy-wide, spanning maybe only a millennia. Others prefer multi-dimensional, million-year space epics. To keep this 'best of' list fair, I have tried to pick some of my favorite all-time science fiction book series that cover all bases.


#10 Wayfarer Series - Becky Chambers


The Wayfarer Series by Becky Chambers is one of the most recently published science fiction series on this list, but it still deserves its place. For anyone new to the genre, it is a fantastic gateway into the world of space-based drama and adventure. 


Becky Chambers brings the notoriously galaxy-spanning stereotype of sci-fi and reduces it down to three relatively small worlds. Her first book, 'A…
articles.title: The 10 best Science-Fiction Book Series Of All-Time (Ranked)

articles.author: Shane O'Neill
articles.description:
On May 24, 2024, the controversial third season of Fortnite Chapter 5 launched, thrusting players into a frenzied and chaotic map. A portion of it has been overtaken by a desolate post-apocalyptic wasteland occupied by sparse thrown-together structures. Players don't want to be caught traversing it on foot, either, seeing as massive weapon-equipped vehicles of all varieties roam the landscape. It's all very much Mad Max-inspired, and yet, there's no Mad Max tie-in to be seen.


The very same day Fortnite Chapter 5: Season 3 kicked off, Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga released in theaters. After ages of development, the story of Mad Max: Fury Road's favorite Imperator Furiosa (Anya Taylor-Joy) was told on the big screen. Thus, it seemed like an opportune time to add some Mad Max franchise skins to …
articles.title: 5 Mad Max skins that would be perfect for Fortnite Chapter 5: Season 3

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
Custom Deliveries in Final Fantasy XIV are an excellent way to gain EXP for your crafters and gatherers, as well as earning Scrips for exclusive items and improved gear. You also get to meet some interesting characters, and there are titles up for grabs as well. 


Before you can even begin to think about undertaking Custom Deliveries, you’ll need to unlock Collectables and the Scrip Exchange. This starts at level fifty with Inscrutable Tastes, and additional ongoing quests become available as you level up. These further quests unlock more inventory and higher-level collectible appraisers in different expansion locations. 


Here’s the list of quests and which level you need to be to unlock them, as well as what they unlock:


Quest
Level
Quest giver
Unlocks


Inscrutable Tastes
50
Morgayn…
articles.title: How to unlock all Custom Deliveries in Final Fantasy XIV

articles.author: Drew Kopp
articles.description:
Fantasy books aren't usually accessible to young people, given their tendency to try and compact a few centuries' worth of fictional worldbuilding into a couple of hundred pages. Fortunately, a growing number of fantasy books written specifically for younger readers are helping to bridge that gap.


Young adult fantasy books existed before I was even a glimmer in my parent's eyes, but they started to gain popularity around the time I started seriously getting into reading. Nowadays, YA fantasy isn't a niche; it's one of the most popular subgenres of literary fantasy, so I'm here to tell you about the top 15 best books for YA fantasy enthusiasts.


The best young adult (YA) fantasy books


I've cobbled together a list of the best YA fantasy books on bookstore shelves. I'm not a literary age…
articles.title: Best Young Adult (YA) Fantasy Books, Ranked

articles.author: Eleanor Hingley
articles.description:
Board and card games are often associated with mechanics more than stories, but these five games are story-rich, inspiring, and appeal to anyone who loves a good tale.


Image via Asmodee


5. Dixit (Libellud/Asmodee)


Originally published in 2008, Dixit is a perennial favorite as a gentle board game with beautiful art and appealing aesthetics that manages to remain fun and relevant without ever becoming too complicated for new players. Players take turns choosing a card from their hand of fanciful picture cards, describe it with a word or very short phrase, and then every other player also chooses a card from their hand that they feel matches that phrase. The chosen cards are shuffled together and players have to decide which they think was the original card. It sounds easy, but the tric…
articles.title: 5 board and card games for the storyteller in your life

articles.author: Drew Kopp
articles.description:
A two-player board game is one of the best remedies for a dull day. Whether you've chosen to stay home or found yourself stuck inside due to weather or sickness, a mono-mono board game is a great way for siblings, friends, and romantic partners to make their time indoors meaningful.


How much enjoyment you'll get from any of the two-player board games on this list depends on many factors. I spent most of my childhood playing one-on-one with friends, so I know on good authority what separates the two-player board games you'' keep pulling out of the closet from those that'll collect a coat of dust.


What defines a two-player board game?


Before we kick things off, I feel it’s important to say that you can play some of the games featured on this list can be played with more than two player…
articles.title: Ten best two-player board games

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
In a recent interview during the Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail media tour, Director Naoki Yoshida dropped a little bit of a bombshell when he asked if players remembered the names of the Convocation of Fourteen. 


Now, if you’re anything like me, you’ll likely be trying to think back through the story of FFXIV, trying to remember all of them. Don’t worry, I’ve cracked open my Encyclopaedia Eorzea collection and refreshed my memory, and now I’ll pass that information on to you. 


I won’t go too deep into the details, as there is a lot of lore surrounding every single member of the Convocation. Consider this a TLDR to bring you up to speed with who we’ve met, who we haven’t and who we may meet in the future.


Who are the Convocation of Fourteen in Final Fantasy XIV?


Image via Square Enix…
articles.title: Who are the Convocation of Fourteen in Final Fantasy XIV

articles.author: Eleanor Hingley
articles.description:
One of the greatest villains of Dungeons & Dragons is Vecna, a lich god with dimension-spanning cults and body parts so evil they corrupt anyone who finds them. Originating in the Greyhawk setting, Vecna has proven to be such a popular villain that his influence has extended to the Forgotten Realms, Ravenloft and even other media like Stranger Things. For DnD's 50th anniversary, it seems only fitting that this world-spanning campaign book, Vecna: Eve of Ruin, puts the Arch-Lich front and centre.


Eve of Ruin is a campaign that takes characters from levels 10 to 20 where the majority of published campaigns focus on lower-level characters. While starting at 10 might be less accessible, it does give Dungeon Masters a great opportunity to work with some of the higher-level monsters. For playe…
articles.title: Review: Vecna: Eve of Ruin

articles.author: Christian Markle
articles.description:
In the world of One Piece, consuming a mythical fruit known as a Devil Fruit will grant the eater supernatural abilities, but there is a catch. In exchange for the power, the eater will lose their ability to swim. In fact, even the mere exposure to seawater greatly weakens them. In the world of piracy, that's a major weakness.


Despite the risk, however, many characters couldn't resist the temptation of power. Thus, numerous ability holders roam the seas. However, not all Devil Fruits are created equal. Here are ten of the strongest Devil Fruits out there.


Image via One Piece Video Games


10. Barrier-Barrier Fruit


Currently wielded by Bartolomeo, the Barrier-Barrier Fruit grants its user the ability to create barriers. While it doesn't sound much, it's actually a pretty powerful abil…
articles.title: 10 strongest Devil Fruits in One Piece

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
I read the first Harry Potter book when I was eight years old and they quickly became a favorite of mine, remaining so to this day. As such, I’m very excited about the Harry Potter series and the possibilities it brings. 


If you’ve only ever watched the Harry Potter movies, I’m sorry to tell you that you’re missing out on the details which make the wizarding world so popular. There are so many features and subplots in the books that are either altered or entirely omitted from the movies. However, the series does offer a chance for these things to get the spotlight they truly deserve. Hopefully.


Peeves


Image via Wizarding World


Peeves is the resident Poltergeist of Hogwarts and, as a Poltergeist, he gets into all manner of mischief. He’s a comic relief character who has a complete d…
articles.title: 15 book features I hope actually appear in the Harry Potter TV series

articles.author: Gabran Gray
articles.description:
I can still remember the awe that washed over me the first time I flew my ship out into the depths of space in No Man’s Sky. 


It was December 2016, and I was – as I often am – a little late to the party. I’d somewhat followed the No Man’s Sky marketing, intrigued by the prospect of getting to live out my space-age fantasies, and I’d absolutely caught wind of the disastrous launch. That didn’t worry me as I headed off into the depths of space – I was borrowing my brother’s copy of the game, anyway. I figured I’d fly for a few hours until, like apparently everyone else had, I got bored and then returned the game. A few months later, I was 300 hours in, and my brother said I could just keep it. 


Since then, No Man Sky has pulled a wild turnaround, winning back the people who left it disen…
articles.title: No Man’s Sky: Adrift has me lost in space again and I love it

articles.author: Leo Gillick
articles.description:
The birth of science fiction is considered by some to stretch all the way back to the age of Shelly's Frankenstein. Since then, there have been some hugely influential writers in the science fiction genre. Here is my personal list, both of the modern age and the old.


Sci Fi writers you need on your bookshelves


Whether you're just delving into the wonderful world of sci-fi or already have shelves straining under Hamilton's epics, there are always a few writers you still need to discover. Take a look through this list to see which writers you may have missed from your collection.


H.G Wells


I may as well get one of the all time greats out of the way, to begin with. H.G. Wells is responsible for some of the greatest works of science fiction literature of all time, with some being adapt…
articles.title: 11 most influential Science Fiction writers of all time

articles.author: Brett Byll
articles.description:
There are a lot of Soulslike games that have taken from plenty of From Software's standard-setting works. Games like Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order have used the format of the Soulslike and thrown in Metroidvania-styled exploration, while also doubling down on a parry mechanic despite being released before Sekiro. 


Still, despite the popularity of Soulslikes, it has not felt like enough games have taken inspiration from Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice. Many fans of From Software's games, as well as those who simply appreciate a well-made video game with fleshed-out combat mechanics, tend to refer to it as a masterpiece. 


So, why a Sekiro-like instead of Soulslike?


It's important to lay out what separates Sekiro from the rest. The game places a special emphasis on its parry mechanic and haste…
articles.title: This could be the Year of the Sekiro-likes

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Streamer Kai Cenat has shown off an incredible life-size statue of Malenia, Blade of Miquella, one of the most challenging bosses, if not the toughest boss in Elden Ring. The statue is a gift and recognizes Cenat's monumental effort into his 24+ hour ordeal with the boss in-game. 


The statue arrives less than a week ahead of the game's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, which promises to add a colossal new area and twist on its gameplay mechanics. While many call it life-size, the images and videos of it make Malenia look absolutely massive, almost as tall as Lady Dimetrescu. Having that towering over you as you face boss after boss in FromSoftware's most brutal DLC can only be a source of inspiration and motivation. 


Kai Cenat celebrated for his Elden Ring achievements with massive Malenia st…
articles.title: Kai Cenat receives life-size Malenia statue to immortalize grueling 24+ hour Elden Ring battle

articles.author: Jovan Krstić
articles.description:
Updated: June 15, 2024


We searched for the latest codes!




The world is on the brink of collapse as the war between humans and Demons wages on. Will you fight back against the wretched Demon army or join them to bring an end to humankind? Once you've chosen your destiny, use Demon Blade codes and lead your faction to victory.


Redeeming codes in Demon Blade will give you Cash, EXP boosts, and Race Spins to help you level up faster, unlock more powerful weapons, and hone abilities. Combined with an inventory full of useful items, you'll become an unstoppable force and rain destruction on your foes. If you're looking for more free rewards in other Demon-Slayer-inspired games, check out our list of +1 Blade Slayer codes and stock up on valuables in no time.


All Demon Blade codes list

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
All over the world, comics have gone through many evolutions in their time and have had their ups and downs, but they’ve never lost their popularity. Not entirely, anyway. And some prove that by still pulling in massive sales numbers.


Here’s a list of the best-selling comics. Now, to be clear, it’s difficult to say “comics” and have it mean just one thing. It could be targeted to omit Manga as a separate category or to specifically be about superhero comics. Should it be single issues or include sales from initial prints in magazines like Weekly Shōnen Jump? A lot of comics sales data are simply estimates because they were never strictly tracked, so it’s hard to even be accurate.


For the purposes of this list, we’ll be looking at collected comics sales. That means anything that was re-…
articles.title: 10 Best-Selling Comics Of All-Time (Ranked)

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
The penultimate episode of Doctor Who season 14 was released on June 14. For fans who were hoping for some answers to questions posed during earlier episodes, I’m afraid this one leaves with nothing except more questions and a yearning for the season finale.


Warning, spoilers for Doctor Who Season 14, Episode 7, The Legend of Ruby Sunday, follow.


I have to admit, The Legend of Ruby Sunday could well be the best episode of the season so far, but that’s not saying much considering we’ve had two ‘Doctor-lite’ episodes and a string of stand-alone stories. However, as opposed to previous episodes, this one feels quintessentially Whovian in the best way, so let’s get into the bones of what happened. 


Thankfully, the episode does indeed put Susan Twist’s character in a much bigger spotlight…
articles.title: Doctor Who brings back a 50 year old villain in shock twist and fans are split

articles.author: Franklin Bellone Borges
articles.description:
The sports manga genre can be considered one of the media's most popular, as showcased by how more than 60 titles belonging to it were released in the last two decades alone. But what differentiates a great sports series from the rest? 


To help you answer that, as well as find a new title to fall in love with, here are the 10 best sports manga of all time, ranked. 


10. Blue Lock


Image via Kodansha Comics



By: Muneyuki Kaneshiro (Story) / Yusuke Nomura (Art)


Demographic: Shonen


Status: Ongoing


Is it officially available in English? Yes



Blue Lock's over-the-top narrative style and novel approach to the competitive mindset within football (or soccer, if you prefer) earned it a spot on our list. The latter makes the manga feel way more like a battle shonen. But don't get me wr…
articles.title: The 10 best sports manga of all time, ranked

articles.author: Martin Ortiz
articles.description:
Ravensburger hosted their second Disney Lorcana Lorecast Twitch stream on June 12, 2024, and despite having some technical issues, it was well worth the wait. Viewers were immediately introduced to the name of the fifth set of the TCG: Shimmering Skies. Since a VOD of the stream wasn’t saved, we’ll provide a thorough recap of everything revealed for the new Shimmering Skies set.


For those unfamiliar with Lorecast, Ravensburger held their inaugural Lorecast back in March to reveal Ursula’s Return. The stream treats viewers to a well-crafted cinematic that introduces the theme, and notable characters of the upcoming set, and then showcases many exciting card and product reveals. 


From this point forward, there will be many spoilers for the Shimmering Skies set. While most of these are fr…
articles.title: Every Disney Lorcana Shimmering Skies reveal so far

articles.author: Christian Dawson
articles.description:
Lego is one of those hobbies many of us picked up as a kid, where we would build medieval castles, underwater labs, or pirate ships to kill hours or days. Then came the deconstruction phase and building your own unique creations. Now, you're an adult with adult money, and Lego is preying on your nostalgia and fandoms to generate revenue. 


The following are 10 of the best Lego sets for adults. This list, understandably, is subjective. I've based it on kits my wife and I have assembled. So, while the Lego Millennium Falcon and Eiffel Tower are out there, I can't attest to their quality as I've not had the pleasure of building them.


The 10 best adult Lego sets


10. Captain Rex Helmet (75349)


Image by Destructoid



Lego Site


854 Pieces



The Lego helmets are fun builds that can be p…
articles.title: 10 best Lego sets for adults

articles.description:
Yacht Club Games hosted its own Direct-style presentation today, primarily to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Shovel Knight. As such, the event featured various Shovel Knight-related announcements, including the reveal of a brand-new game.

This new Shovel Knight game has no title and was not shown, but Yacht Club confirmed it’s in development. It also hinted that various clues about the nature of this title can be found in other Shovel Knight games, suc…

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Developer Arc System Works has revealed Guilty Gear Strive: Dual Rulers, an anime adaptation based on its hit 2021 fighting game. Though there's no release date or window in sight, Arc System Works says Sanzigen Studios is producing the anime. Notably, Sanzigen Studios is the same studio behind protagonist Sol Badguy's "Find Your Way" music video in Guilty Gear Strive. 

As for what to expect from a plot perspective, Arc System Works has revealed little, though it says Dual Rulers will be at this year's Anime Expo 2024 in July. 

"Shigeru Morikawa (famous for Argonavis the Movie: Axia) will direct," the Dual Rulers announcement reads. "Others attached to the project include Guilty Gear writer Norimitsu Kaihō for series composition and Seiji Mizushima (famous for Mobile Suit Gundam 00, Fullmetal Alchemist) as associate producer."

Here's a look at Dual Rulers' key art: 

What do you hope Dual Rulers is about? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Guilty Gear Strive Anime Adaptation Called 'Dual Rulers' Announced

The update will gradually roll out to PS5 players …
